cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as a group of concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. Then the Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: Cosmic Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively).

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below.

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane, where all four elements churn in chaos; an Overheaven, where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld, where evil deities and Fiends reside.

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it.

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Abyss
planes.philosophicalEssence: The Abyss embodies all that is perverse, gruesome, and chaotic. Its virtually endless layers spiral downward into ever more appalling forms.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Loathsome corruption of chaos and evil; temptation to turn against allies in order to survive.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Varies by layer; generally hostile and inhospitable to mortals.

temperature.description: Varies by layer, from scorching to frigid.

layers.name: The Plain of Infinite Portals
layers.description: On layer 1, corroded iron fortresses defend routes to lower layers. Under a glaring red sun, the rocky ground contains gaping craters that are portals to other layers of the Abyss. Other portals lead to Pandemonium, Sigil, the gate-town of Plague-Mort in the Outlands, and the Astral Plane.

notableLocations.name: Broken Reach
notableLocations.description: A fortress containing the portal leading to Plague-Mort, ruled by a succubus named Red Shroud. Those who can prove their strength and mettle can stay unharmed for a few days.

layers.name: Azzagrat
layers.description: Graz'zt's corrupt, decadent city is split across layers 45, 46, and 47. The bustling markets and pleasure palaces of Zelatar draw visitors from across the multiverse in search of obscure magical lore and perverse delights.

notableLocations.name: Argent Palace
notableLocations.description: Graz'zt's seat of power in the city of Zelatar.

notableLocations.name: Zelatar
notableLocations.description: A city whose bustling markets and pleasure palaces draw visitors from across the multiverse.

ruler.name: Graz'zt
ruler.title: Demon Lord
ruler.description: Embodies manipulation and cruelty, tempting mortals with the promise of appalling delights and decadent luxuries.

layers.name: The Demonweb
layers.description: On layer 66, Lolth's web snares all and hides portals to other planes. An immense network of thick, magical webbing forms passageways and cocoon-like chambers. The webs conceal random portals that snare objects from demiplanes and Material Plane worlds.

notableLocations.name: Demonweb Pits
notableLocations.description: Bottomless pits where the Spider Queen dwells with her most loyal servants—yochlol demons.

ruler.name: Lolth
ruler.title: Demon Queen of Spiders
ruler.description: Her schemes entangle entire civilizations on worlds across the multiverse. Of all demon lords, she might have the most active interest in the worlds of the Material Plane.

layers.name: Gaping Maw
layers.description: Layer 88 is a malevolent wilderness surrounding Demogorgon's ocean fortress. A massive primeval continent covered in dense jungle, surrounded by a seemingly endless expanse of ocean and brine flats.

notableLocations.name: Abysm
notableLocations.description: Demogorgon's fortress consisting of two serpentine towers emerging from a turbid sea, each topped with an enormous fanged skull. Echoes of Demogorgon's turbulent thoughts resound through the halls, tearing at the minds of creatures who dare to enter.

ruler.name: Demogorgon
ruler.title: Prince of Demons, The Sibilant Beast
ruler.description: A two-headed monster who yearns for nothing less than undoing the order of the multiverse. Inspires fear and hatred among other demons and demon lords.

layers.name: Thanatos
layers.description: On layer 113, an endless graveyard hosts Orcus and the sleepless dead. A land of bleak mountains, barren moors, ruined cities, and forests of twisted black trees under a black sky.

notableLocations.name: Everlost
notableLocations.description: A vast palace crafted of obsidian and bone, set in a howling wasteland called Oblivion's End, surrounded by tombs and graves creating a tiered necropolis.

notableLocations.name: Oblivion's End
notableLocations.description: A howling wasteland surrounding the palace of Everlost.

ruler.name: Orcus
ruler.title: Demon Prince of Undeath, Blood Lord
ruler.description: A brooding and nihilistic entity who yearns to make the multiverse a place of death and despair, turning all creatures into Undead under his control.

dayNightCycle.description: Black sky with no natural light

layers.name: The Slime Pits
layers.description: Layer 222, a fetid realm of ooze and fungi, obeys the whims of Juiblex and Zuggtmoy. A bubbling morass of fetid sludge, covered in vast expanses of caustic slimes.

notableLocations.name: Zuggtmoy's Palace
notableLocations.description: Two dozen immense mushrooms, among the largest in existence, hollowed into grand chambers and twisting corridors. Surrounded by a field of acidic puffballs and poisonous vapors.

layers.name: The Death Dells
layers.description: Yeenoghu and his gnoll servants prowl layer 422—a cruel, desolate realm of ravines and badlands where creatures must hunt to survive. Even plants try to snare the unwary.

ruler.name: Yeenoghu
ruler.title: Gnoll Lord
ruler.description: Hungers for slaughter and senseless destruction. Delights in sorrow and hopelessness, yearning to turn the cosmos into a wasteland.

layers.name: The Endless Maze
layers.description: Layer 600's endless labyrinth turns visitors into Baphomet's prey. A never-ending dungeon with the Horned King's enormous palace at its center, surrounded by a mile-wide moat concealing submerged stairs and tunnels.

notableLocations.name: Baphomet's Palace
notableLocations.description: An enormous palace at the center of the Endless Maze, a confusing jumble of crooked hallways and myriad chambers, surrounded by a mile-wide moat.

ruler.name: Baphomet
ruler.title: Horned King, Prince of Beasts
ruler.description: Embodies bestial bloodlust. If he had his way, civilization would crumble and all mortals would embrace their predatory instincts.

hazards.name: Abyssal Corruption
hazards.description: The corruption of the Abyss affects visitors. Its virtually endless layers reflect entropic nature, with much of the plane in a decaying, crumbling, or corroded state.

notableEntities.name: Graz'zt
notableEntities.title: Demon Lord
notableEntities.description: Embodies manipulation and cruelty. Rules Azzagrat (layers 45-47).

notableEntities.name: Lolth
notableEntities.title: Demon Queen of Spiders
notableEntities.description: Schemes entangle entire civilizations. Rules the Demonweb (layer 66).

notableEntities.name: Demogorgon
notableEntities.title: Prince of Demons, The Sibilant Beast
notableEntities.description: A two-headed monster yearning to undo the order of the multiverse. Rules Gaping Maw (layer 88).

notableEntities.name: Orcus
notableEntities.title: Demon Prince of Undeath, Blood Lord
notableEntities.description: Brooding nihilistic entity. Rules Thanatos (layer 113).

notableEntities.name: Juiblex
notableEntities.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes, Faceless Lord
notableEntities.description: Amorphous mass lurking in abyssal depths. Co-rules the Slime Pits (layer 222).

notableEntities.name: Zuggtmoy
notableEntities.title: Demon Queen of Fungi, Lady of Rot and Decay
notableEntities.description: Primary desire is to infect the living with spores. Co-rules the Slime Pits (layer 222).

notableEntities.name: Yeenoghu
notableEntities.title: Gnoll Lord
notableEntities.description: Hungers for slaughter and senseless destruction. Rules the Death Dells (layer 422).

notableEntities.name: Baphomet
notableEntities.title: Horned King, Prince of Beasts
notableEntities.description: Embodies bestial bloodlust. Rules the Endless Maze (layer 600).

adventureThemes: Confronting evil in one's own heart
Resisting temptation to betray allies
Desperate last stands against endless hordes
Avoiding detection while seeking holy relics
Contamination of other planes through Abyssal portals

planes.name: Acheron
planes.philosophicalEssence: Acheron is a plane of enforced order, where rigid conformity leads to crushed spirits and broken hopes. Dedicated soldiers forever lacking a cause.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Bloodlust instilled in visitors.

physicalProperties.shape: Immense iron blocks drifting through an airy void
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: An airy void between the iron blocks.

temperature.description: Varies by layer, from metallic coldness to icy extremes.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Colliding blocks create shockwaves and shudders.

layers.name: Avalas
layers.description: Spirit soldiers wage endless wars across debris-strewn battlefields. Contains the largest iron blocks.

layers.name: Thuldanin
layers.description: Pitted, hollow cubes are filled with the cast-off machinery of war.

layers.name: Tintibulus
layers.description: Jagged blocks tumble in darkness, holding frozen memories sapped by the River Styx and crystallized into fleeting images.

layers.name: Ocanthus
layers.description: Maelstroms of razor-sharp debris swirl above a mire of black ice. Shards break off from an icy mire and are gradually assembled into the perfect cubes of Avalas.

hazards.name: Bloodlust
hazards.description: The nature of Acheron instills bloodlust in those who visit the plane.

hazards.name: Block Collisions
hazards.description: Immense iron blocks sometimes collide with a fearsome clang, crushing all between them and sending shudders through the plane.

environmentalEffects.name: Acheron Bloodlust
environmentalEffects.description: The nature of Acheron instills bloodlust in those who visit the plane.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx churns through the top layers of Acheron.

adventureThemes: Confrontation with bleak nihilism of unending conflict
Harsh reality of authoritarian rule
Uncaring pressures of social conformity
What are you fighting for?
Scavenging Thuldanin for weapons of war
Retrieving secrets from frozen memories in Tintibulus

planes.name: Arborea
planes.philosophicalEssence: Arborea is a plane of extremes: stupendously craggy mountains, unbelievably deep gorges, forests of monstrously huge trees, and vast stretches of wheat fields. A larger-than-life place of violent moods and deep affections.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Reckless emotions; rage is as common and honored as joy. Desperate desire to return after leaving.

temperature.description: Warm with sudden squalls that pass quickly.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Sudden squalls brew up out of nowhere, beating paths with heavy winds. Storms pass within minutes, leaving warm flares of sunlight.

layers.name: Arvandor
layers.description: Towering trees, colorful wildflowers, abundant grain, and delicious fruit create a lush environment.

layers.name: Aquallor
layers.description: An eternal ocean fed by the River Oceanus is home to teeming sea life and mighty storms.

layers.name: Mithardir
layers.description: A desert of white sand is abandoned by whatever powers once lived there.

planarConnections.name: River Oceanus
planarConnections.description: The River Oceanus streams across the top layer of Arborea and drains away somewhere in Arborea's second layer.

adventureThemes: Discovering who you are when masks fall away
Emotional honesty and unfettered emotion
Hurt feelings and lingering resentment from candor
Secrets buried in the sands of Mithardir

planes.name: Arcadia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Everything on Arcadia works toward the common good and a flawless existence. Purity is eternal, and nothing intrudes on harmony.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Individuality is subsumed to peaceful life in community.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Governed by four allied demigods called the Storm Kings: the Cloud King, the Wind Queen, the Lightning King, and the Rain Queen.

layers.name: Abellio
layers.description: Everything in these fields of plenty is dedicated to the good of all.

layers.name: Buxenus
layers.description: Military forces gather their strength, amid pleasant valleys and orchards, to reclaim the lost layer of Menausus—now part of Mechanus.

notableLocations.name: Menausus (lost)
notableLocations.description: A former layer of Arcadia that has been absorbed into Mechanus.

environmentalEffects.name: Vigorous Life Energy
environmentalEffects.description: Arcadia is suffused with a vigorous life energy that bestows great vitality on visitors.

notableEntities.name: Cloud King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

notableEntities.name: Wind Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

notableEntities.name: Lightning King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

notableEntities.name: Rain Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four allied demigods governing Arcadia's weather.

adventureThemes: Tension between individual freedom and societal responsibility
Common good vs individuality
Conformity to social expectations

lightLevel.naturalLightSource: An orb floating in the sky: half radiates sunlight, the other half sheds moonlight.

dayNightCycle.description: An orb floats in the sky above both layers. Half radiates sunlight (day), half sheds moonlight (night). The orb rotates evenly without fail.

lightLevel.colorDescription: Perfectly regulated daylight and starry night

planes.name: Astral Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A realm of thought and dream, where visitors travel as disembodied souls to reach the Outer Planes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Realm of thought, memory, and dream.

physicalProperties.shape: A great silvery sea with swirling wisps of white and gray
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst.

timeFlow.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst. Children must grow to maturity on other planes.

hazards.name: Psychic Wind
hazards.description: A psychic wind is a storm of thought that batters travelers' minds rather than their bodies, made of lost memories, forgotten ideas, and subconscious fears. First sensed as a rapid darkening of the silver-gray sky. After 1d4 minutes, the area becomes as dark as a moonless night. Passes in 1 minute.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Each traveler caught in a psychic wind

onFailure.description: Suffers a random psychic effect from the Psychic Wind Psychic Effects table.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A rapid darkening of the silver-gray sky. After 1d4 minutes, the area becomes as dark as a moonless night.

entries.description: At the end of the travel time, the characters arrive at a location other than the intended destination.

entries.effect: Sent through a random color pool
entries.description: Roll on the Astral Color Pools table.

entries.durationDescription: 1 minute; repeat saving throw at end of each turn, ending on success.
5 (1d10) hours; ends if you take damage or another creature takes an action to shake you awake.

portals.colorOrAppearance: Two-dimensional pools of rippling colors, understood rather than seen by the Astral self

notableEntities.name: Nafas
notableEntities.title: Noble Genie
notableEntities.description: Created by the planar winds. A distant and benevolent observer who hears wishes spoken throughout the multiverse.

civilizations.name: Tu'narath
civilizations.description: Perhaps the most infamous city built on the petrified remains of a dead god.
civilizations.location: On a dead god's corpse in the Astral Plane

specialRules.name: Astral Movement
specialRules.description: A traveler in the Astral Plane can move by simply thinking about moving. In combat, a creature has a Fly Speed (in feet) equal to 5 times its Intelligence score and can hover.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Fly Speed = 5 × Intelligence score (can hover). Outside combat, distance is meaningless; movement by thought.

specialRules.name: Astral Navigation
specialRules.description: All that is required to find one's destination is to think about it. Thinking about a place makes the creature aware of the most direct route. The creature doesn't know travel time or peril, just direction.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Thinking about a destination reveals the most direct route. Travel to a specific location takes 4d6 days; to a general location takes 1d4 × 10 hours.

specialRules.name: No Aging
specialRules.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: No aging, no hunger, no thirst.

adventureThemes: Traveling to Outer Planes or Material Plane worlds via Wildspace
Encountering fellow travelers
Plumbing crystallized thoughts of dead gods
Sifting information from psychic winds
Facing Astral manifestations of memories, fears, and dreams

crossReferences.description: Contains extensive information about Wildspace and Astral travel.

planes.name: Beastlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: The Beastlands embodies nature's wildness and beauty, and speaks to the animal within all living creatures with respect to their physical substance and fundamental needs.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Invigorated and more vital; minds more alert, reflexes sharpened, strides quickened. Hunger pangs are acute but food and drink taste better. Sleep is deep and restful.

temperature.description: Ranges from eternal summer noon (Krigala) to eternal twilight (Brux) to eternal night (Karasuthra).

layers.name: Krigala
layers.description: The River Oceanus is a strong torrent flowing through this wilderness of eternal summer noon.

layers.name: Brux
layers.description: A red sun hovers forever on the horizon as mists and streams roil through the trees in eternal twilight.

lightLevel.naturalLightSource: A red sun on the horizon

layers.name: Karasuthra
layers.description: A pale moon provides the only light in this wilderness of eternal night.

dayNightCycle.description: Eternal night illuminated only by a pale moon

hazards.name: Beast Slayer Shapeshifting
hazards.description: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane, the slayer must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane

onFailure.description: Shape-shift into the type of Beast slain. Game statistics replaced by Beast's stat block, but retains alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak. After three failed Long Rest saves, transformation can only be undone by Remove Curse or similar magic.

planarConnections.name: River Oceanus
planarConnections.description: The River Oceanus passes through the top layer of the Beastlands.

specialRules.name: Beast Slayer Shapeshifting
specialRules.description: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane, the slayer must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain. The creature's game statistics are replaced by the Beast's stat block, but the creature retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak. At the end of each Long Rest, the shape-shifted creature repeats the save. On a successful save, the creature returns to its true form. After three failed saves, the transformation can be undone only by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: DC 10 CHA save on killing native Beast or shapeshift into that Beast. Repeat save each Long Rest. Success = return to true form. 3 failures = permanent until Remove Curse.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane

onFailure.description: Shape-shift into the type of Beast slain.

adventureThemes: Good philosophies devaluing physical nature of life
Conflict with those who dismiss animals as inferior
Vibrant power of life in the natural world

planes.name: Bytopia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Bytopia is the heaven of productive work, the satisfaction of a job well done. Personal achievement alongside social interdependence.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Feelings of goodwill and happiness.

physicalProperties.shape: Two layers face each other like the covers of a closed book, about a mile apart.

layers.name: Dothion
layers.description: Farms nestled among well-tamed woods are hubs of pastoral activity and individual industry.

layers.name: Shurrock
layers.description: Small communities thrive around quarries and mills amid rough country and harsh weather.

adventureThemes: Recognizing impact of actions on the world
Mirrored reactions to deeds on opposite layer
Productive work and satisfaction

planes.name: Carceri
planes.philosophicalEssence: The grim inspiration for all other prisons in existence, Carceri is a plane of desolation and despair, home for traitors and backstabbers.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Despair and betrayal; hatreds run like a deep, slow-moving river.

temperature.description: Varies from bogs to frigid oceans and black ice.

layers.name: Orthrys
layers.description: The River Styx meanders through a layer of vast bogs and quicksand.

layers.name: Cathrys
layers.description: The stench of decay hangs over fetid jungles and scarlet plains.

layers.name: Minethys
layers.description: Stinging sand blows in unending storms, hiding the ruins of the ancient city Payratheon.

notableLocations.name: Payratheon
notableLocations.description: Ruins of an ancient city hidden by stinging sand storms.

layers.name: Colothys
layers.description: Deep chasms cut between cruel mountains make foot travel nearly impossible.

layers.name: Porphatys
layers.description: Cold, acidic oceans are fed by constant black snow.

layers.name: Agathys
layers.description: Black ice streaked with red covers this frigid realm.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx meanders through Carceri, but ferries leading out are both rare and expensive.

escapeMethods: Secret hidden passages (guarded by traps and deadly monsters)
River Styx (extremely dangerous, rare and expensive ferries)
blockedSpells: All spells that leave the plane except Wish
prisonRules.portalBehavior: Portals and gates that open onto the plane become one-way only.
prisonRules.escapeRequirement: Prisoners can escape only by becoming stronger than whatever force imprisoned them there.

adventureThemes: Forces that keep characters trapped or imprisoned
Spiritual and psychological imprisonment
Helping unjustly held prisoners escape
Betrayal and despair

planes.name: Demiplanes
planes.philosophicalEssence: Extradimensional spaces with their own physical laws, shaped by the will of their creators.

notableEntities.name: Strahd von Zarovich
notableEntities.title: Vampire Lord of Barovia
notableEntities.description: The land of Barovia exists entirely within a demiplane under his sway.

adventureThemes: Exploring how characters would shape reality
Confronting distortions of reality crafted by villains

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Air
planes.philosophicalEssence: The essential nature of air is movement, animation, and inspiration. Air is the breath of life, the winds of change, the fresh breeze that clears away the fog of ignorance.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Home to constant winds of varying strength. Chunks of earth drift in the openness. Cloud banks infused with magic become solid surfaces.

temperature.description: Mild, except near the Para-elemental Planes where temperature is more extreme. Rain and snow fall near the Para-elemental Plane of Ice.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Storms are frequent, ranging from strong thunderstorms to fierce tornadoes or mighty hurricanes.

notableEntities.name: Wind Dukes of Aaqa
notableEntities.title: Wind Dukes
notableEntities.description: Dedicated to law and good, maintaining vigilant watch against Elemental Evil. Served by aarakocra.

civilizations.name: Aaqa
civilizations.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote, reachable by following a particular sequence of flowing winds.
civilizations.location: Hidden realm in the Plane of Air

domainsOrRegions.name: Aaqa
domainsOrRegions.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote. The Wind Dukes are dedicated to law and good.

domainsOrRegions.name: Labyrinth Winds
domainsOrRegions.description: A complex web of air streams, currents, and winds ranging from stiff breezes to howling gales that can rip a creature apart.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mistral Reach
domainsOrRegions.description: Located near the Para-elemental Plane of Ice, a region of frigid winds and driving snowstorms. Earth motes covered with snow and ice.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sirocco Straits
domainsOrRegions.description: Nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ash, where hot, dry winds scour earth motes into barren chunks of rock.

adventureThemes: Movement, animation, and inspiration
Breath of life, winds of change
Cultists of Evil Air wielding destructive storms
Elemental Evil turning air to vengeful ends

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Earth
planes.philosophicalEssence: Earth symbolizes stability, rigidity, stern resolve, and tradition.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No sun, no air at highest peaks. Most visitors arrive via vast caverns.

temperature.description: Ranges from temperate caverns to volcanic heat near the Furnaces.

civilizations.name: City of Jewels
civilizations.description: The plane's largest cavern (Great Dismal Delve / Sevenfold Mazework) is home to the capital city of the dao. Every building made from precious stones and metals. Protected by a powerful spell that alerts the entire population if a visitor steals even a single stone.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Jewels
domainsOrRegions.description: Capital city of the dao within the Great Dismal Delve. Every building made from precious stones and metals, protected by anti-theft magic.

domainsOrRegions.name: Furnaces
domainsOrRegions.description: Mountains nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Magma. Lava seeps through caverns, air reeks of sulfur. Great forges and smelting furnaces.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mud Hills
domainsOrRegions.description: Abutting the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Landslides wear away slopes, sending cascades into a bottomless swamp. The plane constantly regenerates the land.

adventureThemes: Stability, rigidity, stern resolve, tradition
Elemental Evil: implacable force of destruction
Cultists crushing civilization with earthquakes and landslides

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Fire
planes.philosophicalEssence: Fire represents vibrancy, passion, and change. The light of inspiration, the warmth of compassion, and the flame of desire.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Creatures not native to the plane must cover their mouths and eyes to avoid stinging cinders. Efreet use magic to keep cinder storms from City of Brass.

temperature.description: Comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane. Sources of water are rare.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Fierce winds and thick ash. Wind always blows, sometimes rising to hurricane force.

hazards.name: Extreme Heat
hazards.description: The heat on the Plane of Fire is comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane and poses a similar threat to travelers.

environmentalEffects.name: Extreme Heat
environmentalEffects.description: The heat on the Plane of Fire is comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Poses a similar threat as hot desert conditions on the Material Plane.

notableEntities.name: Torchy
notableEntities.title: Proprietor of Torchy's tavern
notableEntities.description: A sentient Flame Tongue Mace who owns an iron-walled tavern built atop a tall basalt crag. Sells fine ale and seems to have a new wielder every few months.

civilizations.name: City of Brass
civilizations.description: The fabled city of the efreet on the shores of the Sea of Fire. Ornate spires and spiked walls reflect the efreet's grandiose and cruel nature. The heart is the Charcoal Palace where the tyrannical emperor of the efreet reigns.
civilizations.location: Shores of the Sea of Fire

domainsOrRegions.name: Cinder Wastes
domainsOrRegions.description: A great expanse of black cinders and embers crossed by rivers of lava. Roving bands of salamanders battle each other. Obsidian ruins dot the desert.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Brass
domainsOrRegions.description: Perhaps the best-known location on the Inner Planes. The fabled city of the efreet on the shores of the Sea of Fire with ornate spires and spiked walls. Everything seems alive with dancing flames. The most likely place to find any magic item for sale.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Fire
domainsOrRegions.description: A great expanse of lava traversed by efreeti and azer sailors in great brass ships. Islands of obsidian and basalt with ancient ruins and red dragon lairs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Torchy's
domainsOrRegions.description: An iron-walled tavern built atop a tall basalt crag in the middle of a lava river, most easily reached by hot-air balloon. Popular hangout for ballooning enthusiasts.

adventureThemes: Vibrancy, passion, and change
Quests for legendary magic in the City of Brass
Efreet trading in favors
Cultists of Evil Fire seeking volcanic destruction
Magic items available for purchase

lightLevel.naturalLightSource: A blazing sun that waxes and wanes on a 24-hour cycle

dayNightCycle.description: A blazing sun hangs at the zenith, waxing and waning on a 24-hour cycle from white hot at noon to deep red at midnight.

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Water
planes.philosophicalEssence: The nature of water is to flow smoothly and steadily. It is the rhythm of the tide, the nectar of life, the bitter tears of mourning, and the balm of sympathy and healing.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: An endless sea. Air breathers must find land above the surface. Most natives never break the surface.

temperature.description: Warm sun during the day. Weather is a lesson in extremes: calm or battered by storms. Sea of Ice is frigid.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Several times a day, sky clouds over with deluges of rain and lightning. On rare occasions, rogue waves sweep across the plane.

notableEntities.name: Emperor of the Marids
notableEntities.title: Nominal Emperor
notableEntities.description: Dwells in the Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls. Mood is as changeable as the sea. Visitors are welcome to ask favors.

domainsOrRegions.name: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls
domainsOrRegions.description: An opulent palace made of coral and studded with pearls, the glittering centerpiece of the Sea of Light.

domainsOrRegions.name: Darkened Depths
domainsOrRegions.description: The deeper extents where no sunlight reaches. Horrid creatures dwell here; absolute cold and crushing pressure. Krakens and mighty leviathans claim this realm.

domainsOrRegions.name: Isle of Dread
domainsOrRegions.description: Connected to the Material Plane by a storm that regularly sweeps over the island. Ships from different worlds end up wrecked here. Theoretically, travelers who understand the storm could use it to travel to desired Material Plane worlds.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Ice
domainsOrRegions.description: Bordering the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. Frigid water choked with icebergs and sheet ice, inhabited by cold-loving creatures.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Light
domainsOrRegions.description: Life flourishes in the sunlit waters in the upper reaches. Aquatic peoples craft castles and fortresses in coral reefs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Silt Flats
domainsOrRegions.description: Nearest to the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Water is thick with soil and sludge, turning into muddy ground.

adventureThemes: Erosive power of water
Cultists of Evil Water believing seas want to reclaim water from living bodies
Exploration of endless ocean
Destruction by surging tides and maelstroms

lightLevel.naturalLightSource: A warm sun that arcs across the sky, rising and setting from within the water at the horizon

dayNightCycle.description: A warm sun arcs across the sky, rising and setting from within the water at the horizon. At night, a glittering array of stars and auroras.

planes.name: Elysium
planes.philosophicalEssence: Elysium is the embodiment of goodness, a spiritual realm where evil can't abide. Home to creatures of unfettered kindness and a refuge for planar travelers.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Tranquility and contentment seep into bones and souls. The longer a visitor remains, the less reason they find to ever leave.

layers.name: Amoria
layers.description: Small towns on the banks of the River Oceanus, surrounded by lush meadows, are among the most hospitable refuges on the Outer Planes.

layers.name: Eronia
layers.description: Steep hills, craggy mountains, and white granite valleys offer a rugged home for hardy souls.

layers.name: Belierin
layers.description: Lighthouses pierce the fog and form hubs for small communities amid sprawling marshlands. Said to be the prison of some deadly creature.

layers.name: Thalasia
layers.description: The Heroic Isles, rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus, hold the best departed souls.

notableLocations.name: Heroic Isles
notableLocations.description: Islands rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus that hold the best departed souls.

planarConnections.name: River Oceanus
planarConnections.description: The River Oceanus originates in the lowest layer of Elysium (Thalasia) and flows through the plane's layers before cascading onward to the Beastlands.

adventureThemes: Challenging devotion to doing good
Temptation to rest and enjoy well-earned reward
Seeking ancient spirits on the Heroic Isles
Mysterious prisoner of Belierin

planes.name: Ethereal Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A misty, fog-bound dimension providing passage between planes.

layers.name: Border Ethereal
layers.description: Overlaps the Material Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, and Inner Planes. Every location on those planes has a corresponding location here. Visibility usually limited to 60 feet. View into overlapped plane is grayish and indistinct with 30-foot visibility.

layers.name: Deep Ethereal
layers.description: Engulfed by roiling mist. Scattered curtains of vaporous color lead to the Border Ethereal of specific planes. Visibility usually limited to 30 feet. Distance is meaningless.

hazards.name: Ether Cyclone
hazards.description: A serpentine column that spins through the plane, distorting and uprooting everything in its path. Travelers with Passive Perception 15+ receive 1 minute warning: a deep thrum in the ethereal matter.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter.

entries.description: Each character makes a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. If at least half the group succeeds, travel delayed by 1d10 hours. Otherwise, journey's travel time is doubled.
In the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (roll on Ethereal Curtains table).

portals.colorOrAppearance: Curtains of vaporous color distinguishable by texture and temperature

civilizations.name: Radiant Citadel
civilizations.description: A living relic carved from a single massive fossil around the Auroral Diamond. A nexus of diplomacy, trade, histories, and a thriving sanctuary. Fifteen Concord Jewels orbit the city providing transportation. The Keening Gloom, a massive ether cyclone, whirls just beyond the city.

specialRules.name: Border Ethereal Properties
specialRules.description: A traveler on the Ethereal Plane is imperceptible to someone on the overlapped plane. Solid objects on the overlapped plane don't hamper movement of a creature in the Border Ethereal. Exceptions: magical effects (including magical force) and living beings. The Ethereal Plane disobeys the laws of gravity; a creature can freely move in any direction.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Imperceptible to overlapped plane. Not hampered by solid objects (except magical effects and living beings). Free movement in any direction.

domainsOrRegions.name: Radiant Citadel
domainsOrRegions.description: A living relic of 27 great civilizations, carved from a single massive fossil around the colossal Auroral Diamond. A nexus of diplomacy, trade, and sanctuary. 15 Concord Jewels orbit the city providing transportation to founding civilizations' homes.

ruler.name: Communal governance
ruler.description: Power and resources are equitably shared by common agreement.

adventureThemes: Traveling between planes
Scouting and spying via Border Ethereal
Exploring the Radiant Citadel as a home base

crossReferences.description: An anthology of short adventures exploring worlds accessible from the Radiant Citadel.

planes.name: Far Realm
planes.philosophicalEssence: Outside the known multiverse; might be an entirely separate universe with its own physical and magical laws. Too alien for mortal minds to accept without strain.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Horror, incomprehension; knowledge is a struggle of the mind to overcome boundaries of matter, space, and rational thought.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Nothingness through which titanic creatures swim. Unspeakable beings whisper awful truths.

adventureThemes: What it means to be a person
Mental and bodily autonomy
Whether mortals have any control over their fate
Entities beyond comprehension

planes.name: Feywild
planes.philosophicalEssence: A land of soft lights and wonder, a place of music and magic. The plane responds to unfettered emotion. Gives physical expression to powerful emotion and excels at metaphor.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The plane responds to unfettered emotion: flowers tremble at arguments, grass withers under malice, birds chirp at joy.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Mutable geography and weather that responds to emotion.

warpTable.effectDescription: Time passes much faster outside; days in the Feywild correspond to minutes elsewhere.
Time passes faster outside; days in the Feywild correspond to hours elsewhere.
Time passes normally relative to the Material Plane.
Time passes slower outside; days in the Feywild correspond to weeks elsewhere.
Time passes much slower outside; days in the Feywild correspond to months elsewhere.
Time passes dramatically slower outside; days in the Feywild correspond to years elsewhere.

timeFlow.description: Time and distance in the Feywild are mutable. DM can choose a time change or roll on the Feywild Time Warp table after at least 1 day spent on the plane.

hazards.name: Memory Loss
hazards.description: A creature that leaves the Feywild makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature remembers nothing from its time spent in the Feywild. On a successful save, memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When a creature leaves the Feywild

onFailure.description: Remembers nothing from time spent in the Feywild.
onFailure.customCondition: Complete memory loss of Feywild experiences

onSuccess.description: Memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

recoveryMethods: Any spell that can end a curse

hazards.name: Time Warp
hazards.description: Characters might spend a day in the Feywild and realize upon leaving that less or more time has elapsed elsewhere. Applies after spending at least 1 day on the plane.

portals.colorOrAppearance: Places of mystery and beauty with a near-perfect mirror in the Feywild: clearings, pools, circles of mushrooms, tree trunks

requirement.description: Most open infrequently: during a full moon, at dawn on a particular day, for someone carrying a certain item. Can be closed permanently if the land on either side is dramatically altered.

notableEntities.name: Yarnspinner
notableEntities.title: Story-spinning spider archfey
notableEntities.description: Ruler of Fablerise. Loves reading stories to the animals that occupy his domain.

notableEntities.name: Queen of Air and Darkness
notableEntities.title: Queen
notableEntities.description: Rules the Gloaming Court, a realm of twilight and instinctual behavior.

notableEntities.name: Zybilna
notableEntities.title: Archfey
notableEntities.description: Rules Prismeer. Regarded as a fairy godmother, granting wishes for the lost, forsaken, or betrayed.

notableEntities.name: Queen Titania
notableEntities.title: Queen
notableEntities.description: Rules the Summer Court, the most settled and pastoral domain in the Feywild.

specialRules.name: Feywild Memory Loss
specialRules.description: A creature that leaves the Feywild makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. Fey creatures and creatures with Fey Ancestry automatically succeed. On a failed save, the creature remembers nothing from its time spent in the Feywild. On a successful save, the creature's memories remain intact but are a little hazy. Any spell that can end a curse can restore the creature's lost memories.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: DC 10 WIS save on leaving or lose all memories of Feywild visit. Fey and Fey Ancestry auto-succeed. Any curse-ending spell restores memories.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: When leaving the Feywild after any visit

onFailure.description: Remembers nothing from time spent in the Feywild.
onFailure.customCondition: Complete memory loss of Feywild experiences

onSuccess.description: Memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

recoveryMethods: Any spell that can end a curse

specialRules.name: Feywild Time Warp
specialRules.description: While time seems to pass normally in the Feywild, characters might spend a day there and realize upon leaving that less or more time has elapsed elsewhere. DM can choose or roll on the Feywild Time Warp table. A Wish spell can remove the effect on up to ten creatures. Some powerful Fey can grant such wishes if beneficiaries accept a Geas spell and complete a quest.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Roll d20 on Feywild Time Warp table after spending at least 1 day. Wish can remove effect on up to 10 creatures.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fablerise
domainsOrRegions.description: A rambling thicket of twisted roots, thorny vines, and sinuous creepers weaving together to form tunnels, hallways, and domes. Yarnspinner loves reading stories to the animals that occupy his domain.

domainsOrRegions.name: Gloaming Court
domainsOrRegions.description: A realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves accompanied by the music of hooting owls and croaking frogs. Fey here prize intuitive and instinctual behavior over formalized etiquette.

domainsOrRegions.name: Prismeer
domainsOrRegions.description: A large domain encompassing Hither (vast swamp), Thither (ancient forest), and Yon (stormy mountains). Zybilna resides in the Palace of Heart's Desire, a destination for anyone seeking their heart's desire.

domainsOrRegions.name: Summer Court
domainsOrRegions.description: The most settled and pastoral domain, wrapped in perpetual summer warmth with fluttering butterflies and colorful flowers. Residents value elaborate ceremony and ritualized etiquette.

adventureThemes: Physical expression of powerful emotion
Metaphorical adventures
Stolen memories embodied as objects
Mischievous sprites stealing laughter or emotions
Time distortion consequences

crossReferences.description: Prismeer is detailed in this adventure.

planes.name: Gehenna
planes.philosophicalEssence: Gehenna is the plane of suspicion and greed, with no space for mercy or compassion.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suspicion and greed; tensions run high and trust is impossible.

physicalProperties.shape: A volcanic mountain dominates each of the four layers, with lesser volcanic earthbergs drifting in the air.
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Noxious fumes and searing flames from volcanic fissures.

temperature.description: Ranges from volcanic heat to freezing, depending on layer.

layers.name: Khalas
layers.description: Lava illuminates clouds of volcanic ash and steam from the River Styx.

notableLocations.name: Teardrop Palace
notableLocations.description: A bustling market crowded with Fiends and occasional mortal visitors offering forbidden and sinister goods. Named for its teardrop shape with the point diverting lava flow.

layers.name: Chamada
layers.description: Constant lava flows and eruptions make overland travel difficult. Iron zeppelins piloted by yugoloths drift through the constant gray ashfall.

notableLocations.name: Tower Arcane
notableLocations.description: A sinister structure adorned with blades and spikes, guarded by arcanaloths. Rumored to hold yugoloths' history and contract records.

layers.name: Mungoth
layers.description: Acidic ash mingles with falling snow on this freezing layer.

layers.name: Krangath
layers.description: The Dead Furnace is a great mountain suspended in silence and darkness, home to a coterie of liches.

notableLocations.name: Dead Furnace
notableLocations.description: A great mountain suspended in silence and darkness.

hazards.name: Treacherous Volcanic Terrain
hazards.description: The rocky slopes of the plane make movement difficult and dangerous. The ground inclines at least 45 degrees almost everywhere. Steep cliffs and deep canyons present additional obstacles. Volcanic fissures vent noxious fumes or searing flames.

environmentalEffects.name: Gehenna Suspicion
environmentalEffects.description: The plane instills suspicion and greed, making characters unable to trust anyone.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Instills suspicion and greed in visitors.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx churns through the top layers of Gehenna.

adventureThemes: Betrayal when tensions run high
People in need who are yugoloths in disguise
Purchasing forbidden goods at the Teardrop Palace
Infiltrating the Tower Arcane for yugoloth secrets

planes.name: Hades
planes.philosophicalEssence: Hades embodies despair manifested as apathy. Pure, undiluted evil is like an inescapable force of gravity dragging all creatures down in spirit.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Leaching away color and emotion; apathetic despair; slowly kills dreams and desires, draining hope and optimism.

layers.name: Oinos
layers.description: A land of dead-gray ash, stunted trees, and virulent disease is stalked by roving bands of Fiends looking for a fight or recruits for the Blood War.

layers.name: Niflheim
layers.description: Gray pine trees blanket rolling hills and rocky bluffs, and thick mists coil around their trunks.

layers.name: Pluton
layers.description: Shriveled willows, olive trees, and poplars contribute to the gloom of this concentration of the deepest despair in the multiverse.

hazards.name: Plane of Gloom
hazards.description: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane, a visitor makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while in Hades. If the creature reaches 6 Exhaustion levels, it doesn't die. Instead, it permanently transforms into a Larva, whereupon all Exhaustion levels are removed.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane

onFailure.description: Gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while in Hades. At 6 levels, permanently transforms into a Larva.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds 1 Exhaustion level. At 6 levels, transforms into a Larva instead of dying.
onFailure.terminalEffect: Permanently transforms into a Larva, whereupon all Exhaustion levels are removed.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: The River Styx flows through Hades.

specialRules.name: Plane of Gloom
specialRules.description: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane, a visitor makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while the creature is in Hades. If the creature reaches 6 Exhaustion levels, it doesn't die. Instead, it permanently transforms into a Larva, whereupon all Exhaustion levels afflicting the creature are removed.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: DC 10 WIS save per Long Rest. Fail = +1 Exhaustion (irremovable in Hades). 6 levels = permanent Larva transformation (Exhaustion removed, no death).

savingThrow.triggerDescription: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane

onFailure.description: Gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while in Hades.
onFailure.terminalEffect: Permanently transforms into a Larva. All Exhaustion levels removed.

adventureThemes: Why bother? Confronting apathetic despair
Rekindling the passion of life
Pursuing evil spellcasters collecting larvae
Risk of being trapped by overwhelming despair

planes.name: Limbo
planes.philosophicalEssence: Limbo is change. Constant churn applies on mental and emotional levels as well as physical. Visitors must assert their sense of self amid the storm of constant change.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Storm of intrusive thoughts and unruly emotions, forcing confrontation with the transient nature of identity.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: A roiling soup of impermanent matter and energy. Stone melts into water that freezes into metal, then turns into diamond that burns up.

civilizations.name: Githzerai Monasteries
civilizations.description: Githzerai build entire monasteries with their minds, creating sanctuaries amid the chaos.

specialRules.name: No Gravity
specialRules.description: Limbo has no gravity, so creatures visiting the plane float in place. A creature can move up to its Speed in any direction by merely thinking of the desired direction of travel.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: No gravity. Creatures float and can move up to Speed in any direction by thought.

specialRules.name: Move Object
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature in Limbo can make an Intelligence check to mentally move an object within 30 feet of itself that is on the plane and isn't being worn or carried. DC depends on size: DC 5 for Tiny, DC 10 for Small, DC 15 for Medium, DC 20 for Large, DC 25 for Huge or larger. On success, move the object 5 feet plus feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check vs size-based DC. Success = move object 5 + (total - DC) feet.

interactionCheck.name: Move Object in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Mentally move an unattended object within 30 feet.

onSuccess.description: Move the object 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC.

specialRules.name: Alter Object
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make an Intelligence check to alter a nonmagical object within 30 feet that isn't being worn or carried. DC by size: DC 10 for Tiny, DC 15 for Small, DC 20 for Medium, DC 25 for Large or larger. On success, change the object into another nonliving form of the same size.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check vs size-based DC. Success = change object to another nonliving form of same size.

interactionCheck.name: Alter Object in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Change a nonmagical unattended object within 30 feet into another nonliving form of the same size.

onSuccess.description: Change the object into another nonliving form of the same size, such as turning a boulder into a ball of fire.
onSuccess.transformationConstraints: Must be nonliving, same size as original

specialRules.name: Stabilize Area
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make a DC 20 Intelligence check to stabilize an area within a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point it can see. On success, prevent the area from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. DC 20 Intelligence check. Success = stabilize 30-foot-radius Sphere for 24 hours or until next stabilize attempt.

interactionCheck.name: Stabilize Area in Limbo
interactionCheck.description: Prevent an area from being altered by the plane's chaos.

onSuccess.description: Prevent the area from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again.

adventureThemes: Asserting sense of self amid constant change
Mastering internal chaos
Githzerai sanctuaries as refuges
Secrets of the Spawning Stone
Confronting transient nature of identity

planes.name: Material Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Where the philosophical and elemental forces of the other planes collide in the jumbled existence of mortal life and matter. A thoroughly magical place.

notableEntities.name: Corellon
notableEntities.title: God
notableEntities.description: Planted and tended a great tree, a seedling of Yggdrasil, on the First World at the dawn of time.

adventureThemes: Standard D&D adventures
Traveling between worlds via Wildspace, Shadowfell, Feywild, or magic

planes.name: Mechanus
planes.philosophicalEssence: Perfectly regimented order reigns supreme. Law reflected in gigantic clockwork gears interlocked and turning according to their measure.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Individual consciousness subordinated to the search for perfect order; 'I' subsumed into 'we'.

physicalProperties.shape: Gigantic clockwork gears, each with its own gravity pulling toward center. Some cogs are small islands, others hundreds of miles across.

temperature.description: Equal measures of light and dark, equal proportions of heat and cold.

notableEntities.name: Primus
notableEntities.title: Overlord of the Modrons
notableEntities.description: The godlike creator of the modrons, dwelling in Regulus.

civilizations.name: Regulus
civilizations.description: The realm of Primus, creator of the modrons, and the primary hub of Mechanus.

adventureThemes: Examining individual egos in light of the adventuring party
Setting aside personal goals for the group
Asserting individual identity against conformity

planes.name: Mount Celestia
planes.philosophicalEssence: The model of justice and order, of celestial grace and endless mercy. Only the purest souls can reach the highest peak.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Pervasive goodness bestows blessings on creatures.

physicalProperties.shape: A mountain rising from a shining Silver Sea to incomprehensible heights with seven plateaus.

temperature.description: Ranges from the Silver Sea to snowy slopes to ineffable heights.

layers.name: Lunia
layers.description: In the Silver Heaven, the holy water of the Silver Sea laps at the base of the celestial mountain under a starry sky.

layers.name: Mercuria
layers.description: The Golden Heaven's tame slopes and lush valleys are bathed in golden light that evokes the hope of a new dawn.

layers.name: Venya
layers.description: In the Pearly Heaven, terraced fields and tended woodlands dot the snowy slopes.

layers.name: Solania
layers.description: In the Crystal Heaven, holy shrines glitter under a silvery sky amid luminescent fog.

layers.name: Mertion
layers.description: On the sweeping plains of the Platinum Heaven, holy soldiers muster in grand citadels for battles across the planes.

notableLocations.name: Empyrea
notableLocations.description: A city on the edge of a clear lake, renowned for the healing power of its fountains and springs. Pilgrims from across the planes seek out healers, hospitals, and restorative magic.

layers.name: Jovar
layers.description: The Glittering Heaven, strewn with beautiful rubies and garnets, is home to the seven-tiered Heavenly City.

notableLocations.name: Heavenly City
notableLocations.description: A seven-tiered city on the Glittering Heaven.

layers.name: Chronias
layers.description: The Illuminated Heaven is an ineffable mystery.

environmentalEffects.name: Pervasive Goodness
environmentalEffects.description: The pervasive goodness of Mount Celestia bestows blessings on creatures on the plane.

adventureThemes: Proving worthy of blessings
Forswearing selfishness, greed, and hatred
Fiend assaults on shores of Lunia
Evil's true foothold in visitors' secret shame
Healing pilgrimage to Empyrea

planes.name: Negative Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of necrotic energy that destroys the living and animates the Undead. A needy, greedy plane sucking the life out of anything vulnerable.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: A lightless void without end. Only creatures with Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive for long.

hazards.name: Life-Draining Environment
hazards.description: Merely entering the plane is comparable to the life-draining touch of a wraith. Heat, fire, and life itself are drawn into the maw of this plane.

hazards.name: Voidstones
hazards.description: In some locations, negative energy folds in on itself, stabilizing into solid chunks of matter that devour light. Anything that comes into contact with a voidstone is destroyed in seconds. Thought to be the source of Spheres of Annihilation.

adventureThemes: Face-to-face confrontation with annihilation
Drains vitality, energy, and happiness
All the apathy and despair of Hades and Shadowfell combined and concentrated

planes.name: Nine Hells
planes.philosophicalEssence: The ultimate plane of law and evil, the epitome of premeditated cruelty. Devils are bound to obey their superiors' laws but squabble within castes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Cruelty, corruption, insidious manipulation, deceit, and treachery. Temptation to fulfill deepest longings.

temperature.description: Varies from rocky wastelands to frozen hellscapes to volcanic fire.

layers.name: Avernus
layers.description: The Blood War rages across battlefields littered with corpses and the wreckage of hellish war machines. A rocky wasteland with rivers of blood and clouds of biting flies. Fiery comets occasionally fall from the darkened sky.

notableLocations.name: Zariel's Flying Citadel
notableLocations.description: A flying basalt citadel that rakes the battlefields of Avernus.

ruler.name: Zariel
ruler.title: Archdevil of Avernus
ruler.description: Appears as an angel whose skin and wings are scorched. Eyes burn with furious white light that can cause creatures to burst into flame.

layers.name: Dis
layers.description: Iron roads in deep canyons lead to the dreaded Iron City of Dis. A labyrinth of canyons wedged between sheer mountains rich with iron ore.

notableLocations.name: Iron City of Dis
notableLocations.description: A hideous metropolis where planar travelers come to conspire with devils and close deals with night hags, rakshasas, and other Fiends.

ruler.name: Dispater
ruler.title: Archduke of Dis
ruler.description: A manipulator and deceiver, devilishly handsome with small horns, a tail, and a cloven left hoof. One of Asmodeus's most loyal vassals.

layers.name: Minauros
layers.description: Acid falls like rain on putrid bogs and decaying cities. A stench-ridden bog with brown skies and yawning pits beneath the murk.

notableLocations.name: City of Minauros
notableLocations.description: Cyclopean city with slimy walls rising hundreds of feet, containing flooded halls that are Mammon's lair, piled high with treasure.

ruler.name: Mammon
ruler.title: Archduke of Minauros
ruler.description: Resembles a massive serpent with the upper torso and head of a hairless, horned humanoid. Legendary greed; will trade favors for gold instead of souls.

layers.name: Phlegethos
layers.description: Obsidian fortresses bask in the heat of raging volcanoes and magma rivers. Seas of molten magma brew hurricanes of hot wind, choking smoke, and volcanic ash.

notableLocations.name: Abriymoch
notableLocations.description: A fortress city of obsidian and dark glass rising from within Phlegethos's largest volcano caldera, with rivers of molten lava pouring down its walls.

ruler.name: Belial and Fierna
ruler.title: Archdevils of Phlegethos
ruler.description: Both resemble tieflings with red skin and small horns. Rule in tandem; their alliance is unbreakable.

layers.name: Stygia
layers.description: Levistus's prison is a frigid hellscape of jagged ice and cold fire. A freezing realm of ice with cold flames burning and a frozen sea, gloomy sky crackling with lightning.

ruler.name: Levistus
ruler.title: Archduke of Stygia
ruler.description: Once betrayed Asmodeus and is now encased deep in the ice of Stygia as punishment. Rules by communicating telepathically with followers.

layers.name: Malbolge
layers.description: An ever-crumbling mountain threatens to bury visitors. A seemingly endless slope with parts breaking off creating deadly avalanches.

notableLocations.name: Osseia
notableLocations.description: Glasya's citadel supported by cracked pillars and buttresses, with a labyrinth of cells and torture chambers beneath.

ruler.name: Glasya
ruler.title: Archduchess of Malbolge
ruler.description: Asmodeus's daughter. Her cruelty and love of wicked schemes rival her father's.

layers.name: Maladomini
layers.description: Swarms of hungry flies plague dead cities surrounded by utter desolation. A ruin-covered wasteland with dead cities, empty quarries, crumbling roads, and slag heaps.

ruler.name: Baalzebul
ruler.title: Lord of Flies, Archduke of Maladomini
ruler.description: A tall, powerful devil with compound eyes of a fly. Cursed by Asmodeus so any deal he makes leads to calamity.

layers.name: Cania
layers.description: Ice-trapped cities provide shelter in a realm cold enough to freeze the soul. A frozen hellscape whose ice storms can tear flesh from bone.

notableLocations.name: Mephistar
notableLocations.description: An ice citadel where Mephistopheles plots to seize the throne of the Nine Hells.

ruler.name: Mephistopheles
ruler.title: Archduke of Cania
ruler.description: Brilliant and conniving. Asmodeus's greatest enemy and ally. A tall, striking devil with impressive horns and a cool demeanor. Only Asmodeus has ever deceived or thwarted him.

layers.name: Nessus
layers.description: Mighty fortresses stand watch over the deepest pits of the Nine Hells. A realm of dark pits whose walls are set with bleak fortresses. Pit fiend generals garrison diabolical legions.

notableLocations.name: Malsheem
notableLocations.description: A gigantic hollowed-out stalagmite citadel-spire rising from a vast rift of unknown depth. Home to Asmodeus and his infernal court. Also a prison for souls Asmodeus has locked away.

ruler.name: Asmodeus
ruler.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler of the Nine Hells
ruler.description: Most often appears as a handsome, bearded man with four large horns, piercing red eyes, and flowing robes. The most cunning and well-mannered of archdevils. Wields the power of a lesser god.

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: A tendril of the Styx winds through every layer of the Nine Hells, allowing passage from one layer to the next.

notableEntities.name: Asmodeus
notableEntities.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler
notableEntities.description: Supreme tyrant, brilliant deceiver, master of subtlety. Wields the power of a lesser god.

notableEntities.name: Baalzebul
notableEntities.title: Lord of Flies, Archduke of Maladomini

notableEntities.name: Tiamat
notableEntities.title: Queen of Evil Dragons
notableEntities.description: A prisoner on Avernus, ruling her own domain but confined by Asmodeus in accordance with an ancient contract.

notableEntities.name: Geryon
notableEntities.title: Former Archduke of Stygia
notableEntities.description: Serpentine archdevil dismissed by Asmodeus to allow Levistus to retain rule.

notableEntities.name: Bel
notableEntities.title: Former Ruler of Avernus
notableEntities.description: Fell out of Asmodeus's favor and forced to serve as Zariel's adviser.

specialRules.name: No Direct Lower-Layer Portals
specialRules.description: By Asmodeus's orders, no planar portals connect directly to the lower layers of the Nine Hells. The first layer, Avernus, is the arrival point for visitors.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: All visitors must arrive at Avernus. No direct portals to layers 2-9.

adventureThemes: Journey into the heart of evil
Resisting insidious manipulation, deceit, and treachery
Every shred of evil is used
Each layer specializes in exploiting mortal vices
Temptation and corruption

planes.name: Outlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: The plane of neutrality, keeping all aspects of the planes in a paradoxical balance—simultaneously concordant and in opposition.

physicalProperties.shape: A great disk with sixteen gate-towns evenly spaced around the outside edge.
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Varied terrain with prairies, mountains, and shallow rivers.

domainsOrRegions.name: Automata
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Mechanus.

domainsOrRegions.name: Bedlam
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Pandemonium.

domainsOrRegions.name: Curst
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Carceri.

domainsOrRegions.name: Ecstasy
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Elysium.

domainsOrRegions.name: Excelsior
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Mount Celestia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Faunel
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to the Beastlands.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fortitude
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Arcadia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Glorium
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Ysgard.

domainsOrRegions.name: Hopeless
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Hades.

domainsOrRegions.name: Plague-Mort
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to the Abyss.

domainsOrRegions.name: Ribcage
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to the Nine Hells.

domainsOrRegions.name: Rigus
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Acheron.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sylvania
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Arborea.

domainsOrRegions.name: Torch
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Gehenna.

domainsOrRegions.name: Tradegate
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Bytopia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Xaos
domainsOrRegions.description: Gate-town leading to Limbo.

adventureThemes: Conflicts between opposing planar influences
Celestial spies and Fiend assassins
Preserving nature's balance from powerful extremes
Easy travel between gate-towns

crossReferences.description: Includes extensive information on the Outlands.

planes.name: Pandemonium
planes.philosophicalEssence: A plane of overwhelming chaos, a great mass of rock riddled with tunnels carved by howling winds. The plane of last straws.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Brings everyone to the edge of lashing out, breaking down, or dissolving into incoherence—then pushes them over that edge.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Cold, noisy, and dark with no natural light. Wind extinguishes nonmagical open flames. Conversation only by yelling to max 10 feet.

layers.name: Pandesmos
layers.description: Howling winds, dark streams bound for the River Styx, and blowing snow pour through vast, desolate caverns.

layers.name: Cocytus
layers.description: Winds blowing through narrower tunnels create a stronger force and louder wails, making this the so-called 'Layer of Lamentation.'

notableLocations.name: Howler's Crag
notableLocations.description: A jagged spike rumored to have a unique magical property: anything yelled from the top is said to find the ears of its intended recipient—carried on a shrieking, frigid wind—no matter where in the multiverse that person might be.

layers.name: Phlegethon
layers.description: Tunnel walls absorb light while water creates intricate rock formations.

layers.name: Agathion
layers.description: Sealed-off tunnels are largely inaccessible from elsewhere, making them ideal as vaults for ancient secrets.

hazards.name: Howling Winds
hazards.description: Pandemonium is cold, noisy, and dark with no natural light. Wind quickly extinguishes nonmagical open flames such as torches and campfires. It also makes conversation possible only by yelling, and even then only to a maximum distance of 10 feet.

effectOnConversation.reason: Howling winds drown out all normal conversation

planarConnections.name: River Styx
planarConnections.description: Dark streams bound for the River Styx flow through Pandesmos.

adventureThemes: What happens on characters' worst day
Everything goes wrong and the wind won't let up
Frustration without transferring it to players
Howler's Crag for multiverse communication
Ancient secrets in the sealed tunnels of Agathion

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ash
planes.philosophicalEssence: Highlights commonality between air and fire—tendency to movement and change, given a destructive tone by raging conflagration.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash. Thick ash obscures sight beyond a few dozen feet.

adventureThemes: Interaction between air and fire forces
Movement and change with destructive tone

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ice
planes.philosophicalEssence: Forms the border between Air and Water. A never-ending battle to prove strength and ensure survival.
adventureThemes: Proving strength and survival
Bitter cold and dangerous travel

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Magma
planes.philosophicalEssence: The boundary between Earth and Fire; a great range of volcanic mountains.
adventureThemes: Volcanic environments
Boundary between earth and fire

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ooze
planes.philosophicalEssence: Heightens the contrast between stable, rigid earth and steadily flowing water. Said that any object cast here can't be found for at least a century.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Dense muck and slime. Stinging vines. No solid earth underlies the muck.

adventureThemes: Contrast between earth stability and water flow
Hiding artifacts from the multiverse
Powerful magic luring adventurers into the swamp

planes.name: Positive Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of radiant energy and raw life force. A continual furnace of creation, a domain of brilliance beyond mortal comprehension.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No surface. Every bit glows brightly with innate power. Only creatures with Immunity to Radiant damage can survive.

temperature.description: Like the heart of a star.

hazards.name: Overwhelming Radiant Energy
hazards.description: This power is dangerous to mortal forms, which can't handle it for long. Only creatures that have Immunity to Radiant damage can survive there.

adventureThemes: Vibrant life, creative energy, and radiant health
Lasting charge making it hard to calm down
Persistent resistance to disease and despair

planes.name: Shadowfell
planes.philosophicalEssence: A gloomy dimension of death, gloom, and dread. Landmarks similar to Material Plane but distorted and sinister.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Melancholic atmosphere that can afflict characters with despair.

hazards.name: Shadowfell Despair
hazards.description: When the DM deems appropriate (usually not more than once per day), a character not from the Shadowfell makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, affected by despair (roll d6). After a Long Rest, DC 15 Wisdom save to overcome. Calm Emotions or curse-removing magic also cures it.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When the DM deems appropriate, usually not more than once per day

onFailure.description: Affected by despair. Roll d6: 1-3 Apathy (Disadvantage on Death Saves and Initiative), 4-5 Dread (Disadvantage on all saves), 6 Delusion (Disadvantage on Int/Wis/Cha checks and saves). New despair replaces old.

portals.colorOrAppearance: Blots of shadow in dusty crypts, open graves, gloomy places where spirits or stench of death lingers

requirement.situationCondition: Manifest only in darkness, closing as soon as they feel light's kiss.

specialRules.name: Shadowfell Despair
specialRules.description: A melancholic atmosphere pervades the Shadowfell. When the DM deems appropriate (usually not more than once per day), a character not from the Shadowfell makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, roll d6 on the Shadowfell Despair table. If already suffering despair and fails, new replaces old. After a Long Rest, DC 15 Wisdom save to overcome. Calm Emotions or curse-removing magic cures it.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: DC 10 WIS save (DM discretion, max 1/day). Fail = roll d6: 1-3 Apathy (Disadvantage on Death Saves and Initiative), 4-5 Dread (Disadvantage on all saves), 6 Delusion (Disadvantage on Int/Wis/Cha checks and saves). Recovery: DC 15 WIS after Long Rest, or Calm Emotions / curse removal.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: When DM deems appropriate, usually not more than once per day

onFailure.description: Roll d6 on Shadowfell Despair table for despair effect.

domainsOrRegions.name: Barovia
domainsOrRegions.description: The towering spires of Castle Ravenloft loom above the valley of Barovia.

domainsOrRegions.name: Borca
domainsOrRegions.description: Amid opulent estates and impoverished villages, two Darklords pursue their obsessive schemes.

domainsOrRegions.name: Falkovnia
domainsOrRegions.description: Empty countryside surrounds ruined or crumbling cities, fighting a losing battle against an endless plague of zombies.

domainsOrRegions.name: Kalakeri
domainsOrRegions.description: A beautiful land of rainforests, rivers, and lakes is a quagmire of intrigue as three royal heirs transformed into monsters battle for the throne.

domainsOrRegions.name: Lamordia
domainsOrRegions.description: Inventors and scholars violate natural and moral laws in frozen bogs and glacial expanses.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mordent
domainsOrRegions.description: Death in Mordent heralds a haunted afterlife as a restless spirit. The realm of ghost stories and hauntings.

domainsOrRegions.name: Valachan
domainsOrRegions.description: The devious hunter Chakuna roams the jungles, drawing people into fatal contests.

adventureThemes: Encounters with Undead
Explorations of distorted mirror-landscapes
Descents into mist-shrouded Domains of Dread
Horror and impossible escape

crossReferences.description: Domains of Dread are described in more detail.

planes.name: Sigil
planes.philosophicalEssence: A bustling planar metropolis holding countless portals to other planes and worlds. A trader's paradise for goods and information from across the planes.

physicalProperties.shape: Ring-shaped city built on the inner surface of a torus floating above the Spire at the center of the Outlands.

notableEntities.name: Lady of Pain
notableEntities.description: A being on par with deities whose purpose and goals are unknown. Wears ornate robes and a mantle of blades coated in blue-green verdigris surrounding her masklike face. No one knows what she is.

adventureThemes: Trading in planar goods and information
Navigating item-keyed portals
Encounters with planar emissaries
The inscrutable Lady of Pain

planes.name: Ysgard
planes.philosophicalEssence: Glory earned through heroic deeds in battle. The euphoria of an athlete, the exhilaration of a summer storm, the triumphant celebration of victory.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Desire to test mettle against the plane and mighty creatures.

temperature.description: Summers that are long and hot and winters that are cold and unforgiving.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Windswept battlefields, hot summers, cold winters.

layers.name: Ysgard
layers.description: Immense rivers of floating earth grind together in eternal rumbling. Continents float above oceans of volcanic rock.

notableLocations.name: Plain of Ida
notableLocations.description: Where daily festivals let warriors and athletes show off their bravery and skill.

layers.name: Muspelheim
layers.description: The ground smokes and burns beneath the earthbergs of the top layer.

layers.name: Nidavellir
layers.description: Floating chunks of earth are closer together, giving the appearance of endless tunnels with rich mineral deposits.

resurrectionRule.requirement: Killed in combat while in Ysgard

adventureThemes: Lighthearted combat without consequences
Proving mettle against epic foes
Daily festivals of bravery and skill
Secrets in deep caverns
Testing against giants, dragons, and other mighty creatures

globalPlanarConnections.name: Infinite Staircase
globalPlanarConnections.description: An extradimensional staircase connecting the planes. Entrance usually appears as a nondescript door. Changes appearance as it climbs and descends, including ramps, hovering platforms, and clockwork conveyor belts. Doors are often tucked away in dusty, half-forgotten places.

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Oceanus
globalPlanarConnections.description: The water is sweet and fragrant, with headwaters in the Blessed Fields of Elysium. Flows through each of Elysium's layers, passes through the top layer of the Beastlands, streams across the top layer of Arborea, and drains away in Arborea's second layer.

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Styx
globalPlanarConnections.description: Bubbles with grease, foul flotsam, and putrid remains. Churns through the top layers of multiple Lower Planes. Tributaries snake through lower layers. A tendril winds through every layer of the Nine Hells.
hazards: Memory loss from contact with Styx water (see Chapter 3: Hazards)
navigableBy: Sinister ferries crewed by skilled pilots

globalPlanarConnections.name: Yggdrasil, the World Tree
