globalPlanarConnections.description: A cosmic ash tree spanning the Outer Planes and linking them to many worlds of the Material Plane. Roots stretch into the Lower Planes touching Hades and Pandemonium. Most of its trunk rises through Ysgard. Branches stretch through Upper Planes and across the Astral to the Material Plane.
hazards: Ever-changing paths as the tree continues eternal growth

bloodWar.description: Throughout history, the teeming demon hordes of the Abyss and the regimented legions of devils from the Nine Hells have battled for supremacy in the cosmos. The Blood War has raged for millennia, ravaging the Lower Planes. A moment never goes by when demons and devils aren't battling each other somewhere in the multiverse.

factions.name: Demon Hordes
factions.role: Teeming chaotic forces seeking to destroy all order

factions.name: Devil Legions
factions.role: Regimented lawful evil forces seeking supremacy

bloodWar.adventureImplications: Powerful mortal adventurers are sometimes drawn into tangled schemes. Open conflict between Fiends is a constant threat on most Lower Planes. Natives of the Upper Planes take steps to minimize the threat to the rest of the multiverse.

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Portals
planarTravelMethods.description: A portal is a stationary, interplanar connection that links a specific location on one plane to a specific location on another. Some function like doorways, others are locations that exist on multiple planes at once or flicker between planes. Some are vortices joining an Elemental Plane with a similar Material Plane location.
requirements: Meeting any requirements (command, key item, random timing, situation, or time-based)
risks: Guardians charged with blocking certain creatures
destinations: Any plane, depending on the portal

planarTravelMethods.name: Gate (Spell)
planarTravelMethods.description: Can directly transport adventurers to any other plane with precision.

planarTravelMethods.name: Plane Shift (Spell)
planarTravelMethods.description: Can directly transport adventurers to any other plane, with different degrees of precision than Gate. Requires a tuning fork attuned to the destination.
requirements: Tuning fork attuned to destination plane

planarTravelMethods.name: Etherealness (Spell)
planarTravelMethods.description: Allows adventurers to enter the Ethereal Plane.

planarTravelMethods.name: Astral Projection (Spell)
planarTravelMethods.description: Lets adventurers project themselves into the Astral Plane and from there travel to the Outer Planes.

planarTravelMethods.name: Fey Crossings
planarTravelMethods.description: Places of mystery and beauty on the Material Plane that have a near-perfect mirror in the Feywild, creating a portal where the two planes touch. A traveler passes through by entering a clearing, wading into a pool, passing into a circle of mushrooms, or crawling under a tree trunk.
risks: Can be closed permanently if land is altered

planarTravelMethods.name: Shadow Crossings
planarTravelMethods.description: Locations where the veil between the Material Plane and the Shadowfell is so thin that creatures can pass between them. Form in gloomy places where spirits or stench of death lingers. Manifest only in darkness, closing in light.

planarTravelMethods.name: The Dream of Other Worlds
planarTravelMethods.description: Aided by magic, travelers can fall into a deep slumber and dream themselves into a new realm.
destinations: Other worlds of the Material Plane

planarTravelMethods.name: The Great Journey (Wildspace)
planarTravelMethods.description: Characters can undertake an epic voyage through Wildspace and across the Astral Plane aboard a vessel powered by magic. Also possible through the Shadowfell or Feywild.
destinations: Other worlds of the Material Plane

planarTravelMethods.name: Nexus Points
planarTravelMethods.description: Locations that exist in multiple worlds at the same time, possibly at or near roots of the worlds. Can be geographical features or constructed features. Some flit from world to world on a schedule.
destinations: Other worlds of the Material Plane
requirements: May require magic, an object from the destination world, or nothing more than an act of will

planarAdventureSituations.situation: When magic fails to revive a dead person, the only solution is to venture to the Outer Planes to find the person's spirit and either release it from some prison or convince the person to return to life.

People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.
A long-dead oracle is the only one who knows how a terrible prophecy might be averted, but the cataclysmic fulfillment of the prophecy has already begun.
A god has stopped answering prayers and won't respond to any Commune spell.
A devil has tricked an angel into meddling in the Blood War, and the angel seeks mortal aid.
An ancestor of one of the characters must be convinced to bless the character before the full power of the character's bloodline can be unleashed.
A foolhardy knight carried a holy weapon on a doomed mission into the Nine Hells, and the powers of Mount Celestia want the weapon and the knight's remains retrieved.
A titan is imprisoned on an Outer Plane. The characters might be trying to stop those who seek to release it, or they might want to release it to help defend the world from a greater threat.

To prove themselves worthy of an even greater quest, the characters are sent to slay a horrible monster, win the favor of a powerful planar being, negotiate peace between two warring planar factions, or retrieve a long-lost item on another plane.
An item of legend is being sold at auction in Sigil, the City of Brass, or some other planar metropolis.

globalPlanarDissonance.description: Celestials who visit the Lower Planes and Fiends who visit the Upper Planes experience significant discomfort if their visits last more than a few hours. After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature, a Celestial or Fiend makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save and ends when the creature finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature

onFailure.description: Whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds another 1d4 subtracted from all D20 Tests.

recoveryMethods: Finishing a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
